job.title: Data Scientist, New Graduate
job.description: Our mission at Duolingo is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. But we’ve got more left to do — and that’s where you come in!<br><br>Duolingo is the most popular language-learning application in the world, with over 500 million users and over half a billion exercises completed daily. Beyond our core learning product, we have also entered into literacy with Duolingo ABC and English proficiency testing with the Duolingo English Test .<br><br>We are passionate about educating our users, making fact-based decisions, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. We offer meaningful work, limitless learning opportunities, and collaboration with world-class minds. Come brighten your life and over half a billion more!<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do...<br></u></strong><ul> <li> Derive insights from data to influence product roadmaps and drive business results </li> <li> Lead product experiments to create and improve user experiences </li> <li> Apply advanced analytical methods to model user behavior, and collaborate with product teams to develop solutions </li> <li> Develop dashboards, reports, and forecasts </li> <li> Ensure the quality of our tracking and data collection </li> <li> Help preserve our culture of fact-based decision making as we scale </li> <br><br></ul><strong><u>What We’re Looking For…<br></u></strong><ul> <li> Strong understanding of consumer digital products and an interest in applying advanced analytics to business outcomes </li> <li> Pursuing a BS or MS degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, economics, computer science, computational psychology) or commensurate industry experience </li> <li> Graduation expected in Spring 2022 (or Fall 2021) </li> <li> Previous experience with analyzing large datasets and presenting results </li> <li> Skilled in SQL, R, Python, and/or statistical methods to analyze behavioral data </li> <li> Excellent presentation and communication skills </li> <br></ul><strong>Exceptional Candidates...<br></strong><ul> <li> Experience with "big data" and cloud computing technologies like Redshift, Hadoop, Hive, BigQuery </li> <li> Experience articulating business questions and using available data to find answers that translate into product recommendations </li> <li> Self-starter, with a desire both to learn new techniques and guide others </li> <li> Programming experience in Java or Scala is a plus </li> <br></ul><strong>Why you’ll love working here…<br></strong><ul> <li> Language learning opportunities </li> <li> Catered in-house lunches, and breakfast and dinner options </li> <li> Company-wide Hackathon </li> <li> PTO and company holidays </li> <li> Frequent company-wide dinners, monthly celebrations, social clubs, and so much more!</li></ul>
